title: Live updates: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh assassinated; Iran vows revenge
content: Ismail Haniyeh led Hamas, the Palestinian group that runs Gaza, for over a decade. Hamas said he was killed in Tehran after attending the inauguration of Iran’s president.
summary: Ismail Haniyeh led Hamas, the Palestinian group that runs Gaza, for over a decade. Hamas said he was killed in Tehran after attending the inauguration of Iran’s president.

Landslides, heavy rains kill at least 116 in south India’s Kerala state
content: Downpours caused landslides in the hilly Wayanad district of southern India. Authorities fear the death toll will rise as bad weather complicates search-and-rescue efforts.

title: U.S. military launches first airstrike in Iraq in months
content: The operation south of Baghdad targeted unspecified “combatants” and followed attacks on U.S. forces in recent days, officials said.
summary: The operation south of Baghdad targeted unspecified “combatants” and followed attacks on U.S. forces in recent days, officials said.

title: At least 16 reported dead as Maduro meets Venezuelan protests with force
content: Tensions in Caracas grew Tuesday as President Nicolás Maduro accused opposition leader María Corina Machado and presidential candidate Edmundo González of “criminal violence” and a close ally called for their arrests.
summary: Tensions in Caracas grew Tuesday as President Nicolás Maduro accused opposition leader María Corina Machado and presidential candidate Edmundo González of “criminal violence” and a close ally called for their arrests.

title: Son of ‘El Chapo’ pleads not guilty in federal court following dramatic arrest
content: In Mexico, President Andrés Manuel López Obrador demanded that Washington “tell the truth” about what happened in the arrests of two cartel leaders.

title: Belarus pardons German in terrorism case; Russia moves political prisoners
content: The unexpected pardon of Rico Krieger came as at least seven prisoners charged in political cases in Russia were moved from the penal colonies where they were being held to undisclosed locations over the past two days, lawyers and family members said.
summary: The unexpected pardon of Rico Krieger came as at least seven prisoners charged in political cases in Russia were moved from the penal colonies where they were being held to undisclosed locations over the past two days, lawyers and family members said.

title: Have babies for Russia: Putin presses women to embrace patriotism over feminism
content: Women in Russia are being told to forgo education and careers to prioritize having many children, even as Putin’s war in Ukraine drains men from the workforce.
summary: Women in Russia are being told to forgo education and careers to prioritize having many children, even as Putin’s war in Ukraine drains men from the workforce.

title: Blinken, Austin detail new U.S. security commitments for Philippines
content: The defense cooperation plans come as Manila seeks to bolster its ability to resist pressure from an increasingly assertive Chinese military in the South China Sea.
summary: The defense cooperation plans come as Manila seeks to bolster its ability to resist pressure from an increasingly assertive Chinese military in the South China Sea.

title: The Paris Olympics touted climate-friendly food. Athletes demanded more meat.

title: Images of a starving Palestinian boy went viral. The attention saved him.

title: World leaders, ordinary Venezuelans protest Maduro’s reelection claim
content: Authoritarian socialist Nicolás Maduro claimed reelection despite exit polling that showed challenger Edmundo González captured twice as many votes. The United States and others called for transparency.
summary: Authoritarian socialist Nicolás Maduro claimed reelection despite exit polling that showed challenger Edmundo González captured twice as many votes. The United States and others called for transparency.

title: Iran seeks to undermine Trump ahead of election, officials signal
content: The U.S. intelligence community says Iran probably views a Trump victory in November as worse for Tehran’s already poor relations with Washington.
summary: The U.S. intelligence community says Iran probably views a Trump victory in November as worse for Tehran’s already poor relations with Washington.

title: Region braces for Netanyahu to decide Israeli response to Golan Heights strike
content: As tensions rise after a deadly rocket attack launched from Lebanon, diplomats are urging restraint to prevent the war in Gaza from spilling into a regional conflict.
summary: As tensions rise after a deadly rocket attack launched from Lebanon, diplomats are urging restraint to prevent the war in Gaza from spilling into a regional conflict.

title: Palestinians recount deadly abuse in Israeli prisons: ‘It is Guantánamo’
content: The Post spoke to former Palestinian prisoners and lawyers and reviewed autopsy reports, revealing rampant violence and deprivation in Israel’s prison system.

title: Far right in uproar after Israel detains reservists over Gaza detainee abuse
content: Far-right demonstrators broke into Israel’s Sde Teiman base to protest the detentions of guards.

title: Two children killed, others critically wounded in mass stabbing in British seaside town
content: Police said they have detained a teenage boy in the stabbings in the town of Southport.
